alert.note: Alert for Lehigh; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 21 at 3:10AM EDT until July 21 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Warren County in northwestern New Jersey... Eastern Lehigh County in eastern Pennsylvania... Northampton County in eastern Pennsylvania... * Until 400 AM EDT. * At 309 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Allentown, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Allentown, Easton, Bethlehem, Forks, Emmaus, Northampton, Wilson, Washington, Hellertown, Nazareth, Bangor, Pen Argyl, Wind Gap, Bath, Belvidere, Harmony, Oxford, Alpha, Belfast and West Easton. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 50 and 63. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 50 and 76. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 5. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 2 and 5. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
